Package application

Class Company

java.lang.Object
application.Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
The Company class is what we use to alter the employee array and output its data as described by the user. It is the class that we use to add, remove and print the contents of the array
Author:
Bhumit Patel, Soorya Srivatsa

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Employee[] emplist  
    private int numEmployee  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Company()
    This method is the default constructor that initializes the Company object when it is created

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(Employee employee)
    This method adds an employee to the array and the employee information is extracted from the command line
    java.lang.String exportDatabase​(java.io.File targetFile)
    This method accepts a text file and populates the file with the employee database only if the file is empty.
    private int find​(Employee employee)
    This method is used to find the location of an employee in the list and if found, returns the index at which the employee is found
    int getNumEmployee()
    This method returns the number of employees in the array
    private void grow()
    This method grows the size of the array by 4 if it is full
    java.lang.String print​(int index)
    This method prints the employee array in the order in which it exists
    void printByDate()
    This method prints the employee array in the order of the date on which they were hired
    void printByDepartment()
    This method prints the employee array in the order of department in which the employees work
    void processPayments()
    This method is used calculate the payments of all the employees in the array
    boolean remove​(Employee employee)
    This method is used to find an employee and remove it from the array if found.
    boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
    This method looks for the parttime employee from the list and if found, sets the number of hours for that employee

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      This method is the default constructor that initializes the Company object when it is created

  • Method Details

    • getNumEmployee

      public int getNumEmployee()
      This method returns the number of employees in the array
      Returns:
      returns an int that stores number of employees in the array

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      This method is used to find the location of an employee in the list and if found, returns the index at which the employee is found
      Parameters:
      employee - This method takes an employee and looks for it in the array
      Returns:
      an int index which stores location of employee found, otherwise returns -1 if not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      This method grows the size of the array by 4 if it is full

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      This method adds an employee to the array and the employee information is extracted from the command line
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee to be added
      Returns:
      true if add is successful and false otherwise

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      This method is used to find an employee and remove it from the array if found.
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee that is to be removed from the array
      Returns:
      true if removal was successful and false otherwise

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      This method looks for the parttime employee from the list and if found, sets the number of hours for that employee
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee who's hours are to be set
      Returns:
      true if hours are successfully added and false otherwise

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      This method is used calculate the payments of all the employees in the array

    • print

      public java.lang.String print​(int index)
      This method prints the employee array in the order in which it exists
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the employee in the database to be printed
      Returns:
      A string containing all the employee's information

    • printByDepartment

      public void printByDepartment()
      This method prints the employee array in the order of department in which the employees work

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      This method prints the employee array in the order of the date on which they were hired

    • exportDatabase

      public java.lang.String exportDatabase​(java.io.File targetFile)
      This method accepts a text file and populates the file with the employee database only if the file is empty. The method handles all invalid inputs by returning different messages for the user
      Parameters:
      targetFile - This is the file in which the database is to be exported
      Returns:
      A string with the status message indicating the status of the export
